PageTitle: peer default-route-advertise(BGP-VPN instance IPv4 address family view)(IPv4)
FuncDef:
The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise only default routes to a peer.
The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default setting. The peer default-route-advertise command configures a device to advertise only default routes to a peer. The undo peer default-route-advertise command restores the default setting. By default, a BGP device does not advertise any default route to its peer.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv4 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a routing policy.
The value is a string of 1 to 200 case-sensitive characters without spaces. The character string can contain spaces if it is enclosed with double quotation marks (").

The default routes are sent to the peer group only when all the conditional routes are matched.
-

The default routes are sent to the peer group if any conditional route is matched.

Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length of the conditional routes.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Specifies the mask of the conditional routes.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.
